alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Prince Georges (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 28 at 7:34PM EDT until July 28 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT FOR THE NORTHERN DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA...NORTHERN ANNE ARUNDEL... SOUTHEASTERN HOWARD...SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY...WESTERN HARFORD... BALTIMORE AND NORTHERN PRINCE GEORGES COUNTIES AND BALTIMORE CITY... At 733 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Jarrettsville to near Carney to Elkridge, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Baltimore, Columbia, Bowie, Severn, Pikesville, College Park, Crofton, Middle River, Greenbelt, Cockeysville, Langley Park, Beltsville, Elkridge, Riviera Beach, Baltimore-Washington Airport, Fort Smallwood State Park, Gibson Island, Sillery Bay, Millers Island and North Point State Park. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
